segments.text: I feel so bad for that woman, she seems so out of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just standing there, letting the water overflow, like she's lost in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could help her, but I don't know what to do.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, taking those cookies like that, and she doesn't even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like she's really struggling, and no one is there to support her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon, before something bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to give her a hug and tell her everything is going to be okay.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a sense of sadness, watching her like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish there was something I could do to make her feel better.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm really hoping for the best, that she'll be okay and the kids will be safe.
segments.speaker: PAR
